definition: to intensify/to sharpen/to accelerate/to aggravate/to exacerbate/to embitter
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: Last year, high winds stoked wildfires in Southern California and destroyed thousands of homes.
sentences.chinese: 去年，强烈的风势加剧野火的灾情，摧毁数千户房屋。

sentences.english: It could aggravate the symptoms by amplifying the very inflammatory agents that cause them.
sentences.chinese: 这会增加引发这些症状的炎性因子进而加剧症状。

sentences.english: The psychological effects often exacerbate health problems that the physiological stress response has already caused.
sentences.chinese: 心理作用通常加剧了生理负担早已引发的健康问题。

sentences.english: Occasional regional and local armed conflicts flare up, and economic competition is becoming ever more acute.
sentences.chinese: 局部地区的武装冲突时有暴发，经济竞争更为加剧。

sentences.english: He presented with complaints of quadriparesis that had progressed over the course of 2 years.
sentences.chinese: 患者出现四肢轻瘫，在两年病程中逐步加剧。

sentences.english: Another vehicle on road will increase traffic jamm ???
sentences.chinese: 公路上又多了一种机车，会加剧交通拥堵的？

sentences.english: That is fueling specific trade-related concerns in some countries.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家对切身贸易问题的担忧情绪因此加剧。

sentences.english: Which adds to the growing problem of antibiotic resistance.
sentences.chinese: 这种做法加剧了日益严峻的抗菌素耐药性问题。

sentences.english: This policy exacerbates the gap between rich and poor.
sentences.chinese: 这项政策加剧了贫富差距。

sentences.english: These issues will be prime movers in the currency markets as unrest expands.
sentences.chinese: 随着动荡局面加剧，这些问题将是汇市的主推手。

sentences.english: And it deepens household and community poverty.
sentences.chinese: 它还加剧家庭和社区的贫穷。

sentences.english: That could weigh on growth, and intensify frictions over trade.
sentences.chinese: 这可能会拖累经济增长，并加剧贸易摩擦。

sentences.english: Will the "criticism right" of the head teacher worsen the "violent education"?
sentences.chinese: 班主任的“批评权”会否加剧“暴力教育”？

sentences.english: Let stand for a battery, the temperature is too high, the self-discharge of the battery.
sentences.chinese: 电池静置时，温度太高，电池的自放电加剧。

sentences.english: In the late Qing Dynasty, along with the social several unrest, the performance becomed even more apparent.
sentences.chinese: 晚清时期，随着社会动荡的加剧，这种表现更加明显。

sentences.english: Central banks can, of course, print more money, but that would stoke inflation.
sentences.chinese: 当然，央行可以加印钞票，但这会加剧通胀。

definition: to make heavier/to emphasize/(of an illness etc) to become more serious/to aggravate (a bad situation)/to increase (a burden, punishment etc)
to worsen
rapid/sudden
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
to enlarge/to amplify/to magnify
to weaken/to fall off
grave/serious/severe/critical
to increase/to grow in number
to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)
to reduce/to lower/to bring down
to increase (e.g. one's effort)
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
to unbalance/an imbalance
day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
more critical with every passing day
